meanings.definition: The act of burying someone again.
meanings.sent1: The reinterments of the soldiers were done with great respect and care.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery conducted reinterments to make space for new burials.
meanings.sent3: The reinterments of the pets in the backyard made the garden feel like a sacred place.
meanings.sent4: The reinterments of old memories in her mind brought a sense of closure.
meanings.sent5: The reinterments of ancient artifacts in the museum showcased the history of the region.

meanings.definition: The process of moving a body from one grave to another.
meanings.sent1: The reinterments of the deceased were necessary due to land development.
meanings.sent2: The family requested reinterments of their loved one to a family plot.
meanings.sent3: The reinterments of the skeletons in the graveyard seemed like a macabre dance.
meanings.sent4: The reinterments of the fallen soldiers symbolized a final tribute to their sacrifice.
meanings.sent5: The reinterments of the historical figures brought new interest to the local cemetery.
